SENSATION.Definition: something that caused a lot of interest and excitement

ESPIONAGE.Definition: the practice of spying to discover secret information

SMUGGLING.Definition: the process of illegally moving goods into a country

ACCOMPANYING.Definition: being there at the same time

SO MUCH SO.Definition: to such a degree or extent

IN A BID TO.Definition: in an attempt or effort to

KEEP UP.Definition: make it remain at a high level

FLAVOURED.Definition: having a particular taste by the addition of extra material

CHEWED.Definition: bit and broke it into small pieces in the mouth

CAFFEINE.Definition: a chemical found in coffee and tea that makes people more active

BUZZ.Definition: a state of activity and excitement

EXOTIC.Definition: exciting because of coming from a far away country

THRONE.Definition: the special chair used by kings or queens

MONARCHY.Definition: a type of government with a king or queen at the head

CROWN.Definition: special headdress (head decoration) worn by a king

PARTY ANIMAL.Definition: someone who enjoys parties and social activities

FASHIONABLE.Definition: behaving according to the current popular style

MONOPOLY.Definition: the exclusive or only control of the trade

ARISTOCRATS.Definition: people belonging to the high social class

THE PRESERVE OF.Definition: something meant only for certain people

WOOL.Definition: soft thick hair coming from the coat of sheep

ABUNDANCE.Definition: the situation in which there is more than enough of something

OPIUM.Definition: a drug made from the seeds of a flower called poppy

SMUGGLERS.Definition: people who illegally moved goods into a country

DRIED OUT.Definition: completely dried, without water in them

SPIES.Definition: people who were sent to secretly collect information

CAUCASIAN-LOOKING.Definition: looking like a white-skinned man of European origin

PRE-PACKAGED.Definition: already put into a box for sale

CONVENIENT.Definition: easy to use, involving little trouble

SAMPLES.Definition: small amounts to show what the rest was like

PORCELAIN.Definition: a hard shiny substance used to make cups, plates etc.

CERAMIC.Definition: a substance made of clay and hardened by heat

MOLECULES.Definition: the smallest units of a substance

FILTERED.Definition: passed through a device to remove hard and other unwanted material

ORIGINS.Definition: the place or point where it began

SEMI-ADOPTED.Definition: accepted or used to some degree
